alert.note: Alert for Osage (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 14 at 10:20PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Osage County through 1045 PM CDT... At 1020 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 7 miles south of Cedar Vale to 6 miles north of Hardy. Movement was southeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 40 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down small tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations in or near the path include... Elgin... Grainola... Foraker... Bigheart... MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until midnight CDT for northeastern Oklahoma.
